prompt: "If you really loved me, you would agree with me."
hint: This argument uses emotional manipulation instead of logical reasoning.
explanation: This is an Appeal to Emotion - using emotional manipulation (guilt, in this case) instead of providing logical reasons. Love and agreement are independent things; you can love someone while disagreeing with them. The argument bypasses reason entirely.
visual_concept: Appeal to Emotion: Using a sad puppy face to win an argument instead of actual reasons. The heart is being targeted, not the brain.
